thread.title: Christian McCaffrey flashes WR potential at Stanford’s pro day
thread.title_full: Christian McCaffrey flashes WR potential at Stanford’s pro day

title: Christian McCaffrey flashes WR potential at Stanford’s pro day
text:
March 1, 2017 Broncos to interview Christian McCaffrey, Vance Joseph praises Todd Davis, more 
Stanford’s pro day Thursday was pegged as the day to flash his receiver skills. In front of scouts from all 32 teams as well as 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan and Panthers coach Ron Rivera, McCaffrey ran routes with receivers Michael Rector and Francis Owusu and fielded passes from Chris Bonner. After showing out at the combine, McCaffrey decided to not do any testing, such as the 40, bench press and vertical leap. He didn’t need to. 
In the months preceding the combine and Thursday’s pro day, McCaffrey trained at Landow Performance in Centennial, where he worked with multiple former Broncos, including slot receiver Brandon Stokley . 
McCaffrey’s versatility has made him an interesting prospect for multiple teams, especially the Broncos, who own the No. 20 pick in the first round and need help in the return game, in slot and at running back. 
In Indianapolis, McCaffrey had an informal interview with head coach Vance Joseph and general manager John Elway , both of whom sung his praises. 
“This kid is a really good football player,” Joseph said. “If you watch the tape, he’s a pro’s pro.” 
The McCaffrey connections to the Broncos run deep with his father Ed’s storied career in Denver as a receiver alongside Elway, a Stanford grad. 
“That would be awesome. That would be great,” McCaffrey said at the combine of potentially playing for the Broncos. “I would love to play there. But it’s kind of hard to be a fan of anywhere anymore cause you start to wind down things and you don’t know where you’re going to end up. I’ll be happy to play for anybody.” 
Some highlights of McCaffrey at Stanford’s pro day: A post shared by Christian McCaffrey (@run__cmc) on Mar 23, 2017 at 5:16pm PDT McCaffrey showing off his hands doing wr drills. pic.twitter.com/Ori4d3XdZ9

— Courtney Cronin (@CourtneyRCronin) March 23, 2017 NFL scouts seated at the 50 yard line for Stanford’s pro day. Cardinal eying two first round picks in Solomon Thomas & Christian McCaffrey. pic.twitter.com/dPG69mZeF1 
— Courtney Cronin (@CourtneyRCronin) March 23, 2017 Dispatch from #StanfordProDay : @CMcCaffrey5 looking good running all receiver routes pic.twitter.com/bEugOHtLrA 
— Cam Inman (@CamInman) March 23, 2017 Now here’s a phrase we love to say: #WildCaff doing #WildCaff things. #StanfordProDay #GoStanford pic.twitter.com/lXXXqNA0UM
